column2: What! said he, "have not the most ludicrous things always happened to us old anchorites and saints?
column3: What! said he, "have not the most ludicrous things always happened to us old anchorites and saints?

column2: Must I ever be on the way?
column3: Must I ever be on the way?

column2: With thee have I wandered about in the remotest, coldest worlds, like a phantom that voluntarily haunteth winter roofs and snows.
column3: With thee have I wandered about in the remotest, coldest worlds, like a phantom that voluntarily haunteth winter roofs and snows.

column2: 'Nothing is true, all is permitted': so said I to myself.
column3: 'Nothing is true, all is permitted': so said I to myself.

column2: Ah, how oft did I stand there naked on that account, like a red crab!
column3: Ah, how oft did I stand there naked on that account, like a red crab!

column2: Ah, where have gone all my goodness and all my shame and all my belief in the good!
column3: Ah, where have gone all my goodness and all my shame and all my belief in the good!

column2: A haven towards which MY sail is set?
column3: A haven towards which MY sail is set?

column2: Thus spake the shadow, and Zarathustra's countenance lengthened at his words.
column3: Thus spake the shadow, and Zarathustra's countenance lengthened at his words.

column2: Beware lest in the end a narrow faith capture thee, a hard, rigorous delusion!
column3: Beware lest in the end a narrow faith capture thee, a hard, rigorous delusion!

column2: Alas, how wilt thou forego and forget that loss?
column3: Alas, how wilt thou forego and forget that loss?
